newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Elf Nigeria to operate field with Mobil.
newsitem.headline: Elf Nigeria to operate field with Mobil.

text.p: Elf Petroleum Nigeria Limited will operate a Nigerian oilfield on behalf of its joint venture with Mobil Corp's Mobil Producing Nigeria Unlimited, an Elf spokesman said on Monday.
"An agreement has been reached between the two companies that Elf should operate the Amenam oilfield," he told Reuters.
The offshore field in the southeastern Niger Delta lies between Mobil's Oil Mining Lease (OML) 170 and Elf's OML 99.
When operational it will produce 90,000 barrels per day (bpd).
The two companies have been locked in controversy over the rightful owner of the field since its discovery two years ago.
"We have been talking since as to who should operate the field and now it has been decided that it should be Elf," the Elf spokesman said.
"We are now mobilising resources to develop the field," he added.
The start-up date for the development of the field would depend on the joint venture's budget.
Elf and Mobil have separate joint ventures with state-run Nigerian National Petroleum Corp (NNPC). Elf produces 150,000 barrels per day (bpd) and Mobil pumps 450,000 bpd.
But major oil companies operating in Nigeria face hard times ahead following a 40 percent cut by the Nigerian government in their joint venture budget for this year.
